TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Fine-loamy, mixed, superactive, mesic Torriorthentic Haplustolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Connerton loam-rangeland.  (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise stated.)
A--0 to 5 inches; reddish brown (5YR 5/3) loam, dark reddish brown (5YR 3/2) moist; moderate very fine granular structure; soft, friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; slightly effervescent, lime disseminated; moderately alkaline (pH 8.2); clear wavy boundary.  (4 to 12 inches thick)
AB--5 to 10 inches; reddish brown (5YR 5/3) loam, dark reddish brown (5YR 3/3) moist; moderate medium and fine subangular blocky structure; slightly hard, very friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; strongly effervescent, lime disseminated and as few soft masses and filaments; moderately alkaline (pH 8.2); gradual smooth boundary.  (3 to 8 inches thick)
C--10 to 60 inches; reddish brown (2.5YR 5/4) loam, reddish brown (2.5YR 4/4) moist; massive; slightly hard, very friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; strongly effervescent, lime disseminated; moderately alkaline.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Johnson County, Wyoming; NE1/4, NE1/4 of sec. 11, T. 42 N., R. 84 W.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  The mollic epipedon ranges from 7 to 20 inches thick and includes the AB horizon.  These soils are typically calcareous throughout but are leached a few inches in some pedons.  Organic carbon content ranges from .8 to 2.5 percent in the mollic epipedon and decreases uniformly with depth.  The particle size control section is typically loam or clay loam with 18 to 35 percent clay, 20 to 50 percent silt, and 20 to 50 percent sand with less than 35 percent but more than 15 percent fine sand or coarser.  Autogenetic carbonates range from 1 to 8 percent throughout with less than
2 percent pedogenetic carbonates present in any horizon.  The mean annual soil temperature ranges from 47 to 53 degrees F., and the mean summer soil temperature ranges from 59 to 64 degrees F.  EC is less than 4 mmhos throughout.  Rock fragments are typically less than 5 percent but may range from 0 to 15 percent pebbles.
The A horizon has hue of 2.5YR through 7.5YR, value of 4 or 5 dry, 2 or 3 moist, and chroma of 2 or 3.  Reaction is moderately through strongly alkaline.
The AB horizon has the same color and reaction range as that defined for the A horizon.  A stronger grade of structure is required and an increase in clay is common.
The C horizon has hue of 5YR through 10R, value of 4 through 6 dry, 4 or 5 moist, and chroma of 2 through 4.  Inconsistent pedogenetic carbonates occur in some pedons.  Reaction is moderately or strongly alkaline.

COMPETING SERIES.content: COMPETING SERIES:  These are the Nucla, Ralphston, and Terryall series.  Nucla, Terryall, and Ralphston soils have hue no redder than 7.5YR.  Terryall soils also have bedrock at 20 to 40 inches.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Connerton soils are on relict terraces, fan aprons, hill toeslopes, and valley fill.  They formed in mixed, calcareous alluvium derived from redbed sediments.  Slopes are simple and range from 0 to 15 percent.  Elevations are 4,800 to 5,800 feet.  The mean annual precipitation ranges from 11 to 16 inches with about half falling as snow or rain in April, May, and early June.  The mean annual temperature ranges from 44 to 48 degrees F.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Barnum and Redbank soils.  These soils do not have mollic epipedons.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well drained; medium runoff; moderate permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Rangeland, pasture, hayland and wildlife habitat.  Native vegetation consists of bluebunch wheatgrass, western wheatgrass, big sagebrush, and Indian ricegrass.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  North and central Wyoming.  The series is moderately extensive.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana

ORIGIN.content: SERIES ESTABLISHED:  Southern Johnson County Area, Wyoming; 1971.

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:  Previously, this series allowed the entire range of temperatures for a mesic soil.  The MAST and MSST have been narrowed to better reflect the concept of a series.
The superactive cation exchange activity class was added in 03/2003 to the taxonomic classification by the National Soil Survey Center on request of the Lakewood MLRA office, without review of the soil series property data. The remainder of this document has not been updated.
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.
